title: Photoshop to have a glyph palette. Not a joke.
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4479506188_c08b64644b_6627.jpg)

Darren with [TypeDNA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015058/http:/www.typedna.com/) sent this to me to share with all of you. This is a screen grab of what they are working on right now. A glyph palette! This will be part of the [TypeDNA plugins for Adobe's Creative Suite](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015058/http:/www.typedna.com/adobe_cs_font_plugins/). So, until Adobe gives us an integrated glyph palette, perhaps this will do the trick!

See a [larger image](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015058/http:/farm3.static.flickr.com/2687/4479506188_f7078e30a5_o.png) here.

I'm not sure how many questions Darren will answer at present, but if we can keep the questions here I'll let him know about this thread.
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content: I know CS5 previews have been doing the rounds (under NDA) but I guess this suggests no default glyph palette in CS5 :-( but congrats to Darren and co. for knacking out this plug-in.
Well, this is just a CS4 screen grab, but you may make any assumptions you wish. ;)
Don't toy with me Miss Tiffany! :-)
